__e: A man who'd be in charge of a big Japanese prisoner of war camp.
Every school and prisoner of war camp has one.
Why are not you in a POW camp?
A man who'd be in charge of a big Japanese prisoner of war camp.
Every school and prisoner of war camp has one.
Why are not you in a POW camp?
Political prisoners wear a red triangle, like mine.
Why don't you have this fellow placed in a cell for a little while with other political prisoners? Perhaps some of his old friends.
I suppose he was told that we'd met frequently in the last few days, that I'd been the go-between for the political prisoners, and that we are on good terms, you and I.
Maybe -- maybe this whole prisoner exchange is just a smokescreen for an even bigger --
All the prisoners and guards are accounted for.
Maybe, but they're still prisoners. And they're still scared of us.
I want every prisoner that can walk on this parade ground in 10 minutes.
So no more prisoners in the office, right?
As soon as the prisoners are free he will leave with them.
All prisoners present and correct? Splendid.
The point is, you two are jamming me on a prisoner exchange that needs to go down now, now, now!
He also knows you picked up two prisoners who talked.
Well, can I ask, is he or she one of the captives you left behind?
